page.title: 14Local Police
page.content: In 1985 Dorset Police in conjunction with Abbey Life Insurance Company started a scheme to promote good relations between children and policemen.They called this the 'Cop a card'scheme.Nancy,a 6 year old,writes about it.'The policemen in Christchurch carry lots of copcards in their pockets.There are 36 different copcards.Some have Queen Elizabeth on and some have got policewomen on a horses back and some have got river patrol and some have got a peacock on them.I met a policeman in Christchurch.I asked him for a copcard and he gave me a copcard.I have got lots of copcards.I have got 10 copcards now.When I see a policeman anywhere I ask for a copcard.'
